newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks increase losses, eye Wall Street.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks increase losses, eye Wall Street.

text.p: Madrid stocks slightly increased losses at midday on Thursday in a wave of profit-taking, with dealers closely eyeing Wall Street's opening.

Dealers reported foreign investors selling stocks Repsol and Gas Natural after Spain's Industry Ministry said it would propose a four percent decline in the industrial gas tariff to an upcoming cabinet minister's meeting. * General Index was down 4.49 points, or 0.72 pct, to 622.72 * Ibex-35 was down 60.9 points, 0.85 percent, to 7,103.81 * Repsol shed 90 pesetas to 6,390, while Gas Natural was down 1,200 pesetas, or 3.64 percent to 31,800.
Telefonica was off 30 pesetas to 4,540, while Iberdrola was down 15 pesetas to 1,815.
But domestic dealers remained positive, reporting buying activity on dips and in selected stocks.
"International markets are dragging Spain down also. But at certain levels threre are good bids, especially from domestic investors," one Madrid-based dealer said.
